page.title: 01Conservation
page.content: Conservation ------------ This is a conservation area, especially the village of Offham. Which until recent years was the home of those whose work was totally involved with agriculture, now, however, the pattern is changing as the inhabitants either commute daily to London or other local industrial towns to work. there are many houses dating back to the sixteenth and seventeenth century of gret charm and character which have been restored and cosiderably upmarketed now occupied by many retired people. New building has taken place but this can only be done with planning permission to ensure that the environment retains its rural character as much as possible.
